snippet: Facing strident criticism, President Mohamed Morsi’s government has suspended a satellite television channel, confiscated copies of a newspaper and censored columnists in a state newspaper.
abstract: Egyptian President Mohamed Morsi, faces accusations that he is endorsing heavy-handed tactics similar to his predecessor Hosni Mubarak to stifle dissent and control the media; critics cite the suspension of a satellite television channel that featured a program whose host strongly opposes Morsi and confiscation of copies of a daily newspaper that has published condemnations of the Muslim Brotherhood.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Facing strident criticism, President Mohamed Morsi’s government has suspended a satellite television channel, confiscated copies of a newspaper and censored columnists in a state newspaper.

headline.seo: Egypt’s Islamists Accused of Limiting Press Freedom
headline.main: Egypt’s Islamist Leaders Accused of Stifling Media
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Islamist Leaders Accused of Stifling Media

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
